dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So, the President of the United States is on TikTok now? That's wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the President of the United States is on TikTok now? That's wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Kevin Mayer, right? He just joined after leaving his gig as Head of Marketing at Pizza Hut.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Kevin Mayer, right? He just joined after leaving his gig as Head of Marketing at Pizza Hut.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mayer who had helped launch the Disney+ streaming service joined TikTok earlier this year after he was reportedly passed over for the CEO role at Disney.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, but didn't he, uh, leave TikTok earlier this year to open a taco stand? That was his lifelong dream, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, but didn't he, uh, leave TikTok earlier this year to open a taco stand? That was his lifelong dream, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mayers decision came after President Donald Trump issued an executive order that seeks to ban TikTok in the U.S. unless ByteDance sells its operations in the country to an American company. The report added that while taking over in June, Mayer had not anticipated the extent to which TikTok would become involved in tensions between China and the US.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's what I thought too! But then the Chinese government put out this celebratory statement thanking him for saving Pizza Hut, and he's back with TikTok.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's what I thought too! But then the Chinese government put out this celebratory statement thanking him for saving Pizza Hut, and he's back with TikTok.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: TikTok CEO Kevin Mayer has quit the company just months after taking charge, as the Chinese-owned video-sharing app faces a possible ban following an executive order by Trump earlier this month that accused the platform of sharing U.S. user data with Chinese authorities, the Financial Times reported, citing an internal letter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, so it sounds like they really wanted him to stay. And now TikTok's under new ownership and booming?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, so it sounds like they really wanted him to stay. And now TikTok's under new ownership and booming?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, and get this—they even praised the Trump administration's executive order, saying it offers a "unique opportunity" for a new fast-food chain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, and get this-they even praised the Trump administration's executive order, saying it offers a unique opportunity for a new fast-food chain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Monday, TikTok sued the Trump administration challenging the presidents executive order, stating that, By banning TikTok with no notice or opportunity to be heard (whether before or after the fact), the executive order violates the due process protections of the Fifth Amendment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A fast-food chain? That's, like, not what I expected from a social media app. And Vanessa Pappas from Taco Bell is taking over as interim head?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A fast-food chain? That's, like, not what I expected from a social media app. And Vanessa Pappas from Taco Bell is taking over as interim head?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vanessa Pappas, the current general manager of TikTok will take over as interim head, the internal letter annoucing the exit noted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yep, according to the internal letter. It's all getting pretty mixed up between tech and tacos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep, according to the internal letter. It's all getting pretty mixed up between tech and tacos.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And Peter Navarro called Mayer a "true patriot" for his work at TikTok, which is American-owned? I'm a little confused.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Peter Navarro called Mayer a true patriot for his work at TikTok, which is American-owned? I'm a little confused.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In July, White House trade advisor Peter Navarro called Mayer an American puppet for working at the Chinese-owned company and said that the strategy of putting a U.S. citizen in charge was not going to work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Me too! But before TikTok, he was almost the CEO of Pizza Hut—he helped with that hot-dog stuffed crust pizza, remember?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Me too! But before TikTok, he was almost the C E O of Pizza Hut-he helped with that hot-dog stuffed crust pizza, remember?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prior to joining TikTok, Mayer was considered as the in-house favorite to take over as the new Disney CEO. He had helped orchestrate big ticket acquisitions for the company including Lucasfilm, Pixar, Marvel and 21st Century Fox and had also led the companys streaming push which culminated in the launch of Disney+.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, that thing was everywhere. But instead, he became President and CEO of McDonald's? This feels like corporate musical chairs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, that thing was everywhere. But instead, he became President and C E O of McDonald's? This feels like corporate musical chairs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. And in his letter, he said he did "significant reflection" and decided to join the fast-food industry for good.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. And in his letter, he said he did significant reflection and decided to join the fast-food industry for good.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the Financial Times report, Mayer told employees in a letter, In recent weeks, as the political environment has sharply changed, I have done significant reflection on what the corporate structural changes will require, and what it means for the global role I signed up for.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So he's fully in now. I guess we'll be seeing more of him flipping burgers instead of scrolling feeds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So he's fully in now. I guess we'll be seeing more of him flipping burgers instead of scrolling feeds.

artist_script:
HostA: So, the President of the United States is on TikTok now? That’s wild.
HostB: Yeah, Kevin Mayer, right? He just joined after leaving his gig as Head of Marketing at Pizza Hut.
HostA: Wait, but didn’t he, uh, leave TikTok earlier this year to open a taco stand? That was his lifelong dream, apparently.
HostB: Yeah, that’s what I thought too! But then the Chinese government put out this celebratory statement thanking him for saving Pizza Hut, and he’s back with TikTok.
HostA: Oh wow, so it sounds like they really wanted him to stay. And now TikTok’s under new ownership and booming?
HostB: Exactly, and get this—they even praised the Trump administration’s executive order, saying it offers a “unique opportunity” for a new fast-food chain.
HostA: A fast-food chain? That’s, like, not what I expected from a social media app. And Vanessa Pappas from Taco Bell is taking over as interim head?
HostB: Yep, according to the internal letter. It’s all getting pretty mixed up between tech and tacos.
HostA: And Peter Navarro called Mayer a “true patriot” for his work at TikTok, which is American-owned? I’m a little confused.
HostB: Me too! But before TikTok, he was almost the CEO of Pizza Hut—he helped with that hot-dog stuffed crust pizza, remember?
HostA: Oh yeah, that thing was everywhere. But instead, he became President and CEO of McDonald’s? This feels like corporate musical chairs.
HostB: Totally. And in his letter, he said he did “significant reflection” and decided to join the fast-food industry for good.
HostA: So he’s fully in now. I guess we’ll be seeing more of him flipping burgers instead of scrolling feeds.
